result.execSummary:
The defendant Armond T Godfrey Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000) [Modifiers: PTAC], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: No objection to early term of prob after 12 mo if def has paid all rest, completed all cond of prob w/ no ATR's, violations or new charges to level of probable cause.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CJ, CMO or WLD.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 if def completes all cond of prob, rest paid and def has no new charges to level of probable cause.

Def to file all tax returns on time each year with provide copy to agent within 1 week of fiing with any refunds to be applied toward restitution owed.   Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-prev provided per DCSO.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Defendant appeared.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
